greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1/q) * (f(q) / f(q^9))^3 in powers of q where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -1..2500
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of -3 * b(-q) / c(-q^3) in powers of q where b(), c() are cubic AGM theta functions.
Expansion of ( eta(q^2)^3 * eta(q^9) * eta(q^36) / (eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^18)^3) )^3 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = 27 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. of A227454.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ -q] / QPochhammer[ -q^9])^3 / q, {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<-1, 0, n++; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( ( eta(x^2 + A)^3 * eta(x^9 + A) * eta(x^36 + A) / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^18 + A)^3))^3, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 22 2013
